title: >>> A One WAY Ticket
body_text:
Again for all you fans out there, this entry was posted from the Adams household.
________________________________________
_________
It is a battle that will be talked about for weeks and weeks. The final match to see who once and for all heads into DODGEBALL 50 as
the
captains champion is just days away. And there perhaps aren't two bigger names right for the job: Kevin Adams vs. John Tronolone.
---------
JOHN TRONOLONE
---------
Whether you like him or you don't, John Tronolone can never be denied the amount of punishment he has inflicted upon his opponents. From the days of the foam footballs under the Ocean Road Park lights, to the bulletball wars of the famed Wall High School tennis courts, he has literally seen and basically done all in this great sport. But despite the history, he has never once held the coveted captain's crown, the very prize he looks to possess in just days time. His record as captain in the days of old itself is quite poor, having lost three consecutive times [Chris Adams at 9, Jim Martin at 20, and Kevin Megill at 30]. His first, and to this day, only win came at DODGEBALL 35 against one of his biggest rivals, Kevin Fitzpatrick. With his fifth go as team general this weekend, you can bet your ass he will do whatever he must to become
the
man. But he has a huge mountain to climb in the youngest of the Adams brothers.
---------
The Champ KEVIN ADAMS
---------
The reigning champion Kevin Adams has been nothing short of dominant since his return in the middle of Season V. Gunning for whom he feels are the "top dogs", he has proven time and again that he himself is one of those very elite players. To this day, he is the only "Act of Courage" award winner, an accolade he earned the hard way. Many can still remember the days of the dreaded cast in which he used to play in. Despite the injury, he somehow managed to stay at the top of his game. And now at 100%, the future just couldn't look any brighter.
Much like his challenging opponent, he has seen luck turn sour with a loss as team general in his very first try. DODGEBALL 48 turned all of that around with a colossal win over Sara DeCuir. He is the man to beat going into DODGEBALL 49. The question is, will he come out the same way he entered?
..........
DODGEBALL 49, the finale event in the month of July, comes to you live at Wall High School. Be there on Saturday, the 22nd and catch all the great action starting at 6:30.
This is the last event before literally the biggest one of them all, DODGEBALL 50. DODGEBALL 50 returns to its birthplace of Ocean Road Park on Friday, August 4. The mayhem begins at 5pm*. *Unofficial Time*
